entry.title: Come With Me
entry.summary:
Author: Panickymouse29

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 84,661Chapters: 46/?Kudos: 5

Summary: Amelia is the twin sister of James, she looks exactly like their mother while he looks like their father. The duo were close until they got to Hogwarts and she was sorted into Slytherin, it drove a wedge between the siblings but she never stopped loving her brother. So in their final year she tries to convince him to run away with her and their friends to safety. Will he go?

Author: wordswillwrite

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,879Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 11

entry.title: The Glow of Christmas
entry.summary:
Author: ClarkKents_Biceps

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,106Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 7

Summary: “We’re missing something,” Clark said, stepping back to take in the tree. The lights twinkled, ornaments shimmered, but something still felt incomplete. Even Bruce tilted his head, unable to place it.“The star!” Dick shouted suddenly, rummaging through the box with both hands until he pulled it out triumphantly.Clark scooped him up with ease, his arms steady and strong, and floated just high enough so Dick could reach the very top of the tree. The boy stretched out carefully, tongue poking from the corner of his mouth in concentration, and placed the star right at the tip.The moment it settled, the whole tree seemed to glow brighter, the lights catching on the star and scattering golden reflections across the room. Dick’s face lit up with pride, his chest puffed out as if he’d just saved Christmas, Clark looked up at him with a huge, goofy grin, his heart swelling at the sight. Jason had been chewing on a bauble, but he froze mid‑bite, his wide eyes fixed on the star now shining at the top. His mouth fell open in awe.

entry.title: The Dark Knight Before Christmas - A Superbat Year One AU
entry.summary:
Author: EllEmmeCe

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 18,550Chapters: 22/25Kudos: 30

Summary: Gotham is having a very strange Christmas. Bruce Wayne’s latest vigilante experiment, a horned shadowy figure the press has named “Krampus,” was supposed to terrify criminals. Instead, it has gone viral as Gotham’s new holiday mascot. Clark Kent, investigative reporter and part-time baker, is on the case. He is following Krampus’s trail of cookie crumbs (literally) while secretly moonlighting as “Super Santa” to fix Gotham’s holiday chaos. Between gingerbread turtle clues, a viral photo of Krampus tangled in Christmas lights, and Alfred’s endless commentary, Bruce is one bad cape snag away from losing his mind. Meanwhile, Clark is just trying to figure out if Gotham’s scariest new legend is a monster, a myth, or a very grumpy man who needs a hug. It is a holiday season full of crime, cookies, and questionable branding decisions.

entry.title: The Comfort of Family
entry.summary:
Author: Katci

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,647Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 125

Summary: Bruce snuck away to peek near the mechanics of the show. He saw a little boy in a leotard, crouching down and waiting for his cue. His dark hair was crazy, sticking out like it was gelled that way, but it was extremely sleek, like oil dripping off his ears. The little boy glanced and caught eyes with Bruce. Bruce who was currently hiding in between large pieces of machinery. Bruce who was still unnoticed by the bustling workers. Bruce who was not used to being spotted.

entry.title: There's Something So Lonesome About You
entry.summary:
Author: hoeforhoran28

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 78,485Chapters: 19/21Kudos: 1,346

Summary: "Your identity was supposed to be a secret. Not only to protect yourself (and probably least importantly yourself) but others. Your family, your friends. Everyone who stood a chance at being ripped apart by your decision to go out there everyday and put yourself in the crossfire.Not that Bruce had anyone to protect, besides Alfred. But it was still a fucking given."Or: Bruce has been Batman for two years and if he knew anything, it was that when you don a mask, you don it for a reason. An important reason that just doesn't seem to be as important to the rest of the League as it is to him. This is going to be a story about Bruce being coaxed into allowing others behind his carefully built walls. (Specifically one person.)

But when things start to go array for her, she has no choice—and no reason not to—lean on him. Welcome back to the series! entry.title: Overnight Interview
entry.summary:
Author: Anonymous

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 23,263Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 1,642

Summary: Clark flipped a page in his notebook, and quickly adjusted his glasses. “I’ve got another question for you, that I hope-”“Actually, Clark. If you don’t mind, I’m more interested to hear about you.”Clark’s pen slowed on the paper before turning his attention to Bruce. “Me?!”“Yes.” Bruce said, eying the reporter up and down. “Out of all the reporters I’ve spoken to tonight, you’re the only one who seems to care about my thoughts outside of a skincare routine or the lingering trauma of my youth. You’re more…” Bruce's eyes settled softly on Clark’s. “…genuine.”A story in which Clark Kent meets Bruce Wayne at a Gala for interviews. Bruce decides the night will be better used by bringing Clark home with him.

entry.title: Bruce Goes Batty
entry.summary:
Author: AtlasDaMoth

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 16,381Chapters: 15/?Kudos: 969

Summary: In Bruce Wayne's opinion, as The Batman and Gotham's Billionaire, magic was both incredibly illogical, and quite stupid. Guns, swords, secret plots and evil schemes, he could deal with it all. Except for magic. Spells, curses, it was all unknown to him, and he hated it. He formed that idea on the subject at least a good three years ago. And now, as he stares at himself in the mirror, shaking hands gripping the long bat ears that had sprouted upon his head, he finds himself proven right yet again. Magic. Stupid, stupid magic.

entry.title: The Art of Knocking on the Door
entry.summary:

entry.title: Love, Hate and Confusion
entry.summary:
Author: pinkbatman

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,345Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 41

Summary: When Bruce Wayne decides to go to Metropolis for an event and lets his guard down under a false sense of security, he's robbed, beaten, and thrown off a building. Luckily, a powerful man who wears a ridiculous blue and red outfit is there to save him. At the big age of 27, the billionaire falls for the man in a stupid blue suit and red trunks. Fantastic. And quite frankly, Superman feels the same. He had heard of the Billionaire playboy of Gotham, though he had never seen his face before that day. And what a handsome face it was. But Bruce Wayne hates Clark Kent, the jittery, annoying reporter that won't leave him alone. Always pressing for an interview. He wished the guy would leave him alone, but once he finds out Clark seems to interview Superman often, he has no choice but to accept his requests. And Superman hates Batman. The cold, and quite mysterious man that prowls the streets of Gotham dressed like a bat. He'd never seen something so odd in his life. The man kept to himself and barely talked to him. But once he hears rumors of Bruce Wayne providing Batman with hospitality, he decides to pry further into their relationship.
